Forms Facility Rentals Rental Information About KVLS Contact/Directions Board of Directors & Staff Membership Press Releases Star Volunteer Nomination Form Home > The Fair > Vendors Vendors Welcome vendors and thank you for your interest in the Osceola County Fair!  The 2024-2025 Vendor Handbook has been updated to provide you with an abundance of information and a complete guide to exhibiting at the Osceola County Fair.  ALL vendors will be required to complete the application packet, regardless of past history with our event.  We continue to update files and ask for cooperation as we do so.  Also please note, ALL VENDORS will be required to submit a $300 Operating Deposit.  Details can be found within the Vendor Handbook. of Transcript 2024-2025 Vendor Handbook 2024-2025 Vendor Handbook FOOD AND BEVERAGE VENDORS We at the Osceola County Fair are proud that our vendors experience success, and as such, often return year after year. After renewals, there is typically an extremely limited space available.  However, when availability does arise, our Vendor Committee reviews all applications received in search of unique applicants, that take pride in their space, and serve quality products. For consideration please return a completed application, available in the Vendor Handbook. Upon receipt, you will receive confirmation that your information has arrived and will be contacted should a space become available. No phone calls please. of Transcript 10-DAY OUTDOOR VENDORS Non-food outdoor spaces are currently available for 2025. Space is limited, so we will make our best effort to accept unique vendors. Please complete the application, available in the Vendor Handbook, for consideration. of Transcript Events Center Market Place  Vendors The Events Center Market Place has limited space available to vendors for the 2024 Fair. Inside vendors will enjoy presenting their products and services to the community in an air conditioned atmosphere. Please complete the application available in the Vendor Handbook, for consideration. of Transcript HOTEL INFORMATION Hampton Inn Kissimmee North 151 Centerview Blvd, Kissimmee, FL 34741 407-997-7700 Hampton Inn Kissimmee North (hilton.com) For additional options and more information, please refer to the Vendor Handbook. of Transcript Camping There is currently a waiting list for camping spaces at the Osceola County Fair. If you would like to add your name to that list, please complete the form below of Transcript Platinum Sponsors Osceola Heritage Park - 1911 Kissimmee Valley Lane Kissimmee, FL  34744 321.697.3050 kvls@osceolacountyfair.com BUY TICKETS! Home | Events | The Fair | Participate | Facility Rentals | About KVLS | Contact | Site Map | Privacy, Terms & Cookies Copyright ©2025, Kissimmee Valley Livestock Show & Osceola County Fair, Inc.. All Rights Reserved.

Executive Staff - OC Fair & Event Center - Costa Mesa, CA Search for: Search Skip to content Menu Events Events Calendar Imaginology Pacific Amphitheatre Agriculture Programs Centennial Farm The Ranch Community Center Heroes Hall Museum Hours Exhibitions Educational Materials Virtual Museum Photos & Videos Venue Rentals Venue Options Venue Rates Venue Videos Food & Beverage – OVG Hospitality Lodging & Camping Public Information Public records requests Public Meetings Board of Directors Equal Access Information Facilities Information Bid opportunities Environmental Efforts About Us Our Story What’s New Media Center Maps & Directions FAQ Newsletters Employment Staff Contact Us Community Programs OC Fair Be Part of the Fair Management staff Fulfilling the mission of OC Fair & Event Center OUR STORY WHAT'S NEW MEDIA CENTER MAPS & DIRECTIONS FAQ NEWSLETTERS EMPLOYMENT STAFF CONTACT US COMMUNITY PROGRAMS Home » About Us » Executive Staff Executive Staff Leading toward the future View our full departmental contact list . Email our executive team at ocfexec@ocfair.com . James Canfield General Manager and CEO James Canfield was named OC Fair & Event Center’s CEO in June 2025. He brings more than 30 years of leadership experience in venue management, live events and large-scale infrastructure projects. Most recently, he served as Senior Director and General Manager of the Birmingham-Jefferson Convention Complex in Alabama, where he led significant transformations including the completion of Protective Stadium and a major renovation of Legacy Arena. James has also held executive roles at major California venues including the Palm Springs Convention Center, Pasadena Convention Center and Long Beach Convention and Entertainment Center. His work has focused on driving economic impact, community engagement and strategic growth. Michele Capps Chief Business Development Officer Agriculture Education Communications Creative Services Exhibits & Education Guest Experience Marketing Sponsorships & Sales Michele Capps is an accomplished marketing and public relations executive focusing on business development, branding, lifestyle marketing and advertising. Her expertise has been instrumental in the leisure and hospitality industry, particularly at Cedar Fair’s West Coast properties and Palace Entertainment Corporate. Michele has led PR and marketing efforts for a portfolio of 50 properties, including amusement parks, water parks, hotels, restaurants, campgrounds and animal parks. mcapps@ocfair.com Melissa Au-Yeung Chief Administrative Officer Finance Human Resources Admissions Information Technology Melissa Au-Yeung was appointed the Chief Administrative Officer on January 1, 2023 and oversees the Finance, Human Resources, Admissions, and Information Technology functions. Prior to joining OC Fair & Event Center, she had more than 18 years of experience working in a wide variety of public agency operations for several local public agencies, most recently serving as Deputy City Manager. Melissa completed her undergraduate degree at Vanguard University and received her Masters in Public Administration with an emphasis in Urban Management from California State University, Fullerton in 2006. mauyeung@ocfair.com Open Chief Operating Officer Master Site Planning & Capital Projects Fair Production Security Event Operations Facility Operations Planning & Production Food & Beverage OC Fair & Event Center (OCFEC) is currently recruiting for the position of Chief Operating Officer. Serving as a member of OCFEC’s executive management team, the Chief Operating Officer provides strategic direction for the organization by working with executive management as well as the Board of Directors to establish long-range goals, strategies, plans and policies. The Chief Operating Officer provides leadership to guide OCFEC’s operations functions in support of the organization’s mission, vision, operational core values and strategic priorities. To learn more and to apply, please see the link below: cpshr.us/recruitment/2519/ More at OCFEC Annual OC Fair Pacific Amphitheatre Centennial Farm Heroes Hall Imaginology WANT MORE? Support of OC Fair & Event Center provides year-round educational opportunities and helps fund community give-back programs.
